etymology.description: Depicts a person sick in bed
etymology.interpretation: The character 疒(nè, "illness") visually represents a person lying down with a vertical line indicating a bed, symbolizing the concept of being bedridden due to sickness or disease.

examples.chinese: 医生诊断出他的疒症(醫生診斷出他的疒症)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng zhěnduàn chū tā de nè zhèng.

examples.chinese: 他因疒困扰(他因疒困擾)，常感疲惫(常感疲憊)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yīn nè kùnrǎo, cháng gǎn píbèi.
examples.english: He is troubled by illness, often feeling fatigued.

examples.chinese: 许多汉字含有疒(許多漢字含有疒)，象徵着疾病之意(象徵著疾病之意)。
examples.pinyin: Xǔduō hànzì hányǒu nè, xiàngzhēng zhe jíbìng zhī yì.
examples.english: Many Chinese characters contain the element '疒', symbolizing illness.
